sense.def: Alternative Writing xiao bian yi jing 小便遺精. Illness Sign of a passage of urine mixed with semen. Ben cao yan yi 本草衍義 Substance Entry chi shi zhi 赤石脂：赤石 脂，今四方皆有，以舌試之，粘著者為佳。有人病大腸寒滑，小便精出 , 諸熱藥服及一斗二升，未甚效。後有人教服赤石脂、乾薑各一兩，胡椒 半兩，同為末，醋糊丸如梧桐子大，空心及飯前米飲下五七十丸，終四 劑，遂愈 , “Nowadays, chi shi zhi is available everywhere. Those that have a sweet flavor when tested with the tongue are best. There was a man who suffered from cold smoothness in his large intestine, and urination with emission of essence . He ingested all types of heating medications, in quantities of 1 dou to 2 sheng , but without good effect. Later someone told him to ingest pills the size of wu tong seeds made, with vinegar as a binder, from a powder prepared from 1 liang each of chi shi zhi and gan jiang , and ½ liang of hu jiao , to be ingested with a cold rice decoction on an empty stomach before meals. Each dose was 50 to 70 pills. After four doses the cure was achieved”.
